attributes.action: Justice for the senseless murders of British returning residents to Jamaica!!
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
On 3rd September 2006,Roy Weller aged 70, formerly of Croydon,England was brutally murdered at his home in West Moreland, Jamaica. This made him the 183rd returning resident to be murdered within the last 5 years. The murder is believed to be the work of a local gang. To date no charges have been brought against any of the perpetrators.

The Weller family want the following points addressed.

Equal rights for returning British residents- Because Mr Weller had Dual Citizenship his family were not entitled to any British intervention that may have secured forensic evidence.

Proper police liaison and forensics -Although there were witnesses and forensic evidence, due to the lack of resources in Jamaica the case has not been properly investigated. 

Counselling and support for families -Although British Citizens and taxpayers the Weller Family received no support to help them through their ordeal. ‘ No family should have to experience what we went through we were totally alone’

Financial support for families of victims - Apart from monetary donations from friends and family the family received no financial help nor are they entitled to any compensation.

reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
